name: Cloud 9 Surfing Area
description: Surfing Capital of the Philippines. World-class barreling right-hand reef break. Features an iconic wooden boardwalk and viewing deck. Peak season is Sept-Nov.

name: Magpupungko Rock Pools
description: Natural Tidal Pools. Accessible only during low tide, these unique rock formations create a natural, protected swimming pool resembling a jacuzzi. Located in Pilar.

name: Sohoton Cove National Park
description: A protected reserve in Bucas Grande Islands. Features dramatic limestone cliffs, caves (like Magkukuob Cave), and the Stingless Jellyfish Sanctuary. Best explored via boat/kayak tours.

name: Siargao Island Hopping
description: Popular tri-island tour to Naked Island (a sandbar), Daku Island (largest, w/ cottages, site of boodle fights), and Guyam Island (small, picturesque palm-tree covered islet).

name: Bonok-Bonok Maradjaw Karadjaw Festival
address: Bonok-Bonok Maradjaw Karadjaw Festival, Surigao City
description: An annual cultural and religious festival in Surigao City every September 10th. Celebrated in honor of St. Nicholas of Tolentino, featuring street dancing in traditional attire.

name: Maasin River (Bohol-like)
description: A peaceful river known for its famous ""bent"" or leaning coconut tree with a rope swing, popular for photo opportunities and paddleboarding. Can explore nearby mangroves by canoe.

name: Mabua Pebble Beach
description: A unique mainland beach in Surigao City composed of smooth, naturally polished gray and black pebbles instead of sand. Great for sunset viewing.

name: Alegria Beach
description: Siargao's most beautiful beach according to many travelers. Pristine white sand, crystal-clear turquoise water, peaceful atmosphere. Located in Santa Monica, about 90 minutes from General Luna.

name: Pacifico Beach
description: Emerging surf and tourist hub in northern Siargao. Long stretch of golden sand beach, great surf breaks, and laid-back atmosphere. Less crowded alternative to General Luna.

name: Pasikon Beach
description: Hidden gem beach with white sand and crystal-clear water. Small entrance fee (80 pesos). Very few tourists, mostly locals. Vendors sell cold beer on-site.

name: Naked Island
description: Pure white sandbar with no vegetation. Small and often crowded but iconic stop on island hopping tours. Best for photos during early morning.

name: Daku Island
description: Largest of the three islands. Features local cottages, palm trees, and hosts traditional boodle fight lunches. Good for swimming and sunbathing.

name: Guyam Island
description: Tiny, picturesque island covered in palm trees. Perfect for quick swims and iconic photos. Can walk around the entire island in minutes.

name: Sugba Lagoon
description: Stunning emerald-green lagoon surrounded by limestone cliffs. Second largest mangrove system in Philippines. Features wooden diving board, kayaking, paddleboarding, and cliff jumping. Located in Del Carmen.

name: Kawhagan Island
description: Small island near Sugba Lagoon. Great for sunset viewing and swimming. Often included in Sugba Lagoon day tours (Tour E).

name: Pamomoan Island
description: Another island destination near Sugba Lagoon. Less crowded, good for snorkeling and beach relaxation. Part of extended island hopping tours.

name: Tayangban Cave Pool
description: Adventurous 240-meter water-filled cave trek leading to a natural grotto pool. Waist-deep to chest-deep water. Features rope swing and jumping platform at the end. Mandatory guide (160 PHP entrance + 100-200 PHP guide).

name: Hagukan Cave
description: Part of Sohoton Cove. Entrance requires diving under rock ledge. Famous for bioluminescent plankton that glow electric blue when disturbed. Stunning natural phenomenon.

name: Magkukuob Cave
description: Another cave in Sohoton Cove National Park. Features 5-meter cliff jumping platform. Part of comprehensive Sohoton tours.

name: Taktak Falls
description: Siargao's only waterfall. 14-meter cascade in lush jungle setting in Santa Monica, northern Siargao. Features natural pool for swimming, tree jumping spots. 50 PHP entrance + 20 PHP parking. 1.5 hours from General Luna.

name: Tubig-Ajan Cold Spring
description: Off-the-beaten-path cold spring near Magpupungko. Requires short boat ride across river from village. Crystal-clear freshwater pool. Best visited at low tide.

name: Coconut Trees View Deck
address: Coconut Trees View Deck, General Luna
description: Iconic roadside pull-off (not an actual deck) on main road between General Luna and northern Siargao. Symmetrical rows of coconut palms create perfect photo backdrop.

name: Coconut Road (Burgos)
description: Long, straight concrete road through coconut palm groves with almost perfect symmetry. Popular for sunrise/sunset photos and motorbike rides.

name: Catangnan-Cabitoonan Bridge
description: 349-meter bridge connecting two villages. Solar-lit at night. Best spot for sunset viewing with unobstructed sky views. Nicknamed ""Afam Bridge"" by locals.

name: Canijugan Peak
description: Trekking destination in Del Carmen offering panoramic views of Siargao and surrounding sea. Challenging hike but rewarding summit views.

name: Siargao Wake Park
description: Cable wakeboarding park nestled among coconut trees. Caters to beginners and experienced riders. Also offers hydro foiling, surfing, and water zipline. Good for families and kids.

name: Paddleboarding at Maasin River
address: Paddleboarding at Maasin River, General Luna
description: Explore mangroves and river systems by SUP or canoe. Strong paddler recommended due to changing tides and currents. Adventure through winding mangrove paths.

name: Bayatakan Farm Experience
description: Organic farm visit offering farm-to-table experiences. Learn about sustainable farming, coconut production, and local agriculture. Interactive tours available.

name: General Luna Market
description: Bustling local market offering fresh produce, seafood, handmade crafts, and local products. Great for experiencing authentic island culture and shopping for souvenirs.

name: Siargao Bleu Resort & Spa
description: 4-star beachfront resort offering luxury accommodations with spa services. Located in the heart of General Luna, close to Cloud 9 and other major attractions.

name: Nay Palad Hideaway
description: 5-star luxury resort offering exclusive hideaway experience. Premium accommodations with world-class amenities and services.

name: The Ohm Siargao Resort
description: Highly rated resort located 5-minute drive to Tourism Road. Modern amenities with excellent service and comfortable accommodations.

name: Woody's Place Siargao
description: Steps from General Luna Beach with pool and rooftop area featuring high-speed WiFi. Perfect for digital nomads and beach lovers.

name: Siargo Beach Resort
description: Boutique beach resort featuring pool, restaurant, and bar. Intimate setting with personalized service and beachfront access.

name: Kalipay Resort Siargao
description: Popular beachfront resort offering comfortable accommodations with direct beach access. Well-known among travelers for its excellent location and service.

name: Las Palmas Villas
description: Luxury villa accommodations with beautiful pool area. High-end amenities and exclusive atmosphere for discerning travelers.

name: Kermit Surf Resort
address: 200m from Cemetery surf spot, General Luna
description: Surf-focused resort located 200m from Cemetery surf spot and 2km from Cloud 9. Features the famous Kermit Restaurant with brick oven pizza.

name: Ocean 101 Beach Resort
description: 3-star beachfront resort with on-site restaurant. Comfortable accommodations with direct beach access and dining options.

name: Hue Hotels and Resorts Siargao
address: Near General Luna Beach, General Luna
description: Modern hotel near General Luna Beach offering comfortable rooms and contemporary amenities. Convenient location for exploring the island.

name: Mad Monkey Hostel Siargao
description: Budget-friendly hostel located 7-minute walk from Cloud 9. Social atmosphere perfect for backpackers and solo travelers. Features Mad Monkey Kitchen with great value meals.

name: Pacifico Beach Resort
description: Beachfront resort in Northern Siargao with on-site restaurant and lounge. Located about 1 hour from General Luna, offering a quieter beach experience.

name: Pacifico Bigwish Beach Resort
description: Highly rated beachfront resort at Pacifico Beach. Peaceful setting away from the crowds with excellent service.

name: LaFinca Hostel Siargao
description: Budget-friendly hostel steps from Pacifico Beach with surf board rentals available. Great for surfers and budget travelers.

name: Cabanas Pacifico Siargao Tourist Inn
description: Steps from beach with on-site restaurant serving local and Asian cuisine. Comfortable cabana-style accommodations.

name: Coleto Siargao
description: Beautiful property with lush greenery and cute bungalows. Massage services available. Tranquil atmosphere perfect for relaxation.

name: Darosa Del Mar Beach Resort
description: Private beach resort offering exclusive beach access and peaceful surroundings. Ideal for those seeking privacy and tranquility.

name: NOGS Homestay
description: Homestay near Magpupungko Rock Pools, 1.7 miles from beach. Convenient base for exploring northern Siargao attractions.

name: Kermit Restaurant
description: Famous for brick oven pizza and homemade pasta. Located at Kermit Surf Resort, 2km from Cloud 9. One of Siargao's most popular dining destinations.

name: Shaka Cafes
description: Vegetarian and vegan-friendly cafe famous for smoothie bowls. Located at Cloud 9 on Tourism Road. Healthy options and fresh ingredients.

name: Kaimaná
description: Highly rated restaurant and local favorite. Known for excellent food quality and service. Popular among both tourists and locals.

name: The Bliss
description: Filipino-Western fusion cuisine near Cloud 9. Creative menu combining local flavors with international techniques.

name: Kawayan Siargao Restaurant
description: Fine dining restaurant featuring fresh seafood and Japanese-inspired dishes. Upscale atmosphere with quality ingredients.

name: Warung Siargao
description: Authentic Indonesian fare on Tourism Road. Brings the flavors of Indonesia to Siargao with traditional recipes.

name: Green Waves Café
description: Best smoothie bowls on the island with great breakfast options. Popular morning spot for healthy and delicious meals.

name: Goodies Cafe and Restaurant
address: Tourism Road between General Luna and Cloud 9
description: Conveniently located on Tourism Road between General Luna and Cloud 9. Offers variety of dishes in a casual setting.

name: Mad Monkey Kitchen
description: Great value pasta and pizza with vegan and vegetarian options. Located at Mad Monkey Hostel, popular among backpackers.

name: Cevicheria
description: Best kinilaw (Filipino ceviche) on the island. Fresh seafood prepared in traditional style. Located in Catangnan.

name: Big Belly
description: Famous for Wagyu beef burgers. Premium burger joint in General Luna with quality ingredients.

name: Bulan Pizzeria
description: Wood-fired pizzas and pasta in General Luna. Authentic Italian-style cooking with fresh ingredients.

name: Loka Siargao
description: Beachfront social hub at Cloud 9 with dining from 6am-8pm. Popular gathering spot with ocean views and good food.

name: Munchies @ Jacking Horse
description: Traditional Filipino food with beachfront dining. Authentic local dishes in a casual beach setting.

name: Siargao Hawker
description: Authentic Singaporean food in Siargao. Brings Southeast Asian hawker-style cuisine to the island.

name: Halika
description: Artisanal gelato shop featuring unique Filipino flavors like ube cheese and mango float. Perfect dessert spot.

name: Pare's Paresan
description: Local Filipino pares (braised beef stew) restaurant. Affordable comfort food at ₱189. Authentic local dining experience.

name: Catangnan BBQ
description: BBQ skewers across from many accommodations in Catangnan. Popular street food spot with grilled meats and local favorites.

name: Bollox Bar and Restaurant
description: Local favorite at Pacifico Beach. Casual dining with good food and drinks in northern Siargao.

name: Jungle Cafe
description: Refreshing dishes in a jungle setting at Pacifico. Relaxed atmosphere with healthy and fresh menu options.
